description:
Not only will this be a Yelp review, but it will also be my public apology to El Tepa. 

For starters, ten long years ago, I literally worked two minutes away from El Tepa, and I never set foot inside. I truly regret this.

I will admit it right here - I'm pretentiously picky. 

I'm so used to this fabricated notion that a restaurant should look like some "fancy-shmancy", commercialized establishment and I was too dumb to realize that I should never judge a book -- well hell, you know the rest of that saying.

As for El Tepa, I now work nearby again and I've eaten there more times than I can count. You can think of El Tepa as a neighborhood "Chipotle", but don't expect "Chipotle", expect something better.

This place definitely has its roots firmly planted in the Mission. I get that feeling of local ambiance whenever I walk in. I love how I can order from the menu, then customize my food, tweaking it the way that I want it - just like Chipotle - but better. Like I said, much better. The service is great, it always comes with a smile and a friendly greeting. The food preparers are attentive and they always confirm my order, and their salsa bar is clean and fully stocked. Speaking of salsa, I do have one gripe -- I need bigger cups for my pickled jalapenos and carrots. Those little cups at the salsa bar don't cut it. Hell, just give me a bag, I'll fill that puppy. Outside of that, keep doing what you're doing.

Some early mornings, I may pass by El Tepa on my way to work (and NO, I'm not stalking the place) -- but sometimes, I'll see their staff diligently cleaning and prepping for the day ahead. It may be typical restaurant work, but I like that kind of commitment. It shows that El Tepa aims to bring their "A" game to their customers and they really do.

I just wish that I was their customer, ten hungry years ago. That was my bad and I'm sorry. I missed out. I'm just happy that I discovered El Tepa later, rather than never.
author: John A.

description: 9 months later and everything is still fantastic. I usually order on the phone for pick-up. The spicy chicken which i'm thinking is slow cooked in a crockpot is amazing. The spicy chicken is what I want on my super nachos every time I order. I also love their simple corn quesadilla. The salsa bar is always well maintained and the staff continue to be very nice and consistent on making yummy food.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
When I went in line to order at El Tepa, the guy in front of me was ordering/chatting with one of the ladies behind the counter in Spanish. Then, they both stopped, looked at me, and started grinning. As they continued chatting, the lady glanced back at me several times.  

Ummm, ok. This is awkward. 

IF I have a booger hanging out of my nose -  tell me, por favor!

Anyhow, El Tepa Taqueria has been here for over a decade and I've passed by so many times but never thought to stop in until yesterday. I just finished my appointment down the block and all I can think of was a burrito. 

Gallardos is cash only which I rarely carry so El Tepa it was!

My go-to at taquerias is always a lengua burrito but they don't serve any offal at El Tepa so I decided to order a Tostada Salad w/ al pastor & refried beans ($8.95) and a Watermelon Agua Fresca (L - $2.75). My order also came with a complimentary basket of chips and dibs to their salsa bar: http://bit.ly/2x4qo3B. 

Wow, is all I can say. I was expecting mediocrity (or worse) because you never hear about El Tepa and they have so little reviews for being in business as long as they have. 

The multi-layer tostada shell was light and crispy, and was layered with refried beans, a generous serving of al pastor then topped with shredded lettuce, crema, cheese, tomato, red onions, and cilantro. The al pastor was well-seasoned and I loved all the fatty, caramelized edges. The refried beans were very smooth though when combined with the al pastor, it's a touch too salty. More lettuce would have helped to balance the saltiness but nonetheless, it was a surprisingly solid tostada salad. I will definitely opt for guacamole next time for an extra $1. 

The accompanying chips reminded me of a less salty and less greasy version of Chevy's chips which are purely addicting IMO. The salsas were on point - I really enjoyed the creamy tangy salsa verde (w/ avocado?) and the smoky orange salsa (reminds me a little bit of La Vic's orange sauce but more robust, smoky, and spicy). They also have two types of pico de gallo, and the spicy version had a good amount of jalapenos for some fiyah. 

I washed everything down the Watermelon Agua Fresca which was watered down but otherwise, a good thirst quencher. I would probably skip this next time and just enjoy their complimentary fruit infused water. 

The cashier was friendly and I like that cleanliness seems to be important to them. The salsa bar was well-stocked and very clean. I constantly saw an employee wiping down the tables after a customer left. And, kudos for using compostable [Greenware] cups!

I came after the lunch rush so I was able to find easily seating. As the food options are scant in this part of The Mission, this place seems to be frequented by nearby techies. 

Overall, El Tepa is a surprisingly solid taqueria. Though I can only vouch for their al pastor, if you ever find yourself in this quiet part of The Mission and hangry, give this unassuming taqueria a shot!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I was really excited to try this place since it reminded me so much of Chipotle but with a sense of authenticity. Unfortunately it was a very disappointing experience. The portion was decent, but if I'm paying almost $10 for loaded nachos, at least give me good, crunchy chips. 

I should've questioned it when I saw them digging into the bottom of the trash bin, yes a literal trash bin is where they store their chips. Never has "bottom of the barrel" so accurately described a situation. I mean, this 5"2 lady lifted the bin from it's handle and flipped it upside down like a bully would do to a kid for some lunch money.

Their al pastor "bbq pork" was flavorless and came with grilled onions that weren't even sweet. The guac was just ok, but the salsa was pretty decent. 

Definitely not coming back here since there are so many other places to try in the area.
author: Cam C.

description:
Hidden gem in the Mission. 

Came get around 3pm on a Saturday afternoon and it was pretty quiet. They were playing a movie on the huge flat screen TV. 

We ordered 2 super quesadilla. One with beef and one with carnitas. Both were delicious. The carnitas tasted like the pernil we used to make at home for holidays, well seasoned and slightly gamey. 

Their quesadillas aren't like the kind you get at other places. They look like flattened burritos and if you get a super, it comes loaded with sour cream and guac. They cut it into 3 large pieces. 

Each meal also comes with chips and they have a little salsa bar by the register. I like the creamy orange sauce.
author: Junella T.

description: This place is awesome! The staff is friendly and the super taco is the best $5 dinner around. You get a heaping pile of deliciousness with two corn tortillas buried somewhere underneath for $4.75. The chicken is grilled to perfection and the one time they ran out of guacamole they cut up a fresh avocado and just put the whole damn thing on top! I love this place. You should eat here. Right now.
author: Lowell W.

description:
Food:

Chicken quesadilla - pretty standard fair.  Good amount of chicken when you want something simple.

Flan - dang forgot to take a picture of this but its cause it went down into my stomach too quick.  A pretty good texture to it and one of the better flans I had.

Service: definitely a nice staff.

Ambiance:  a pretty standard taqueria where you line up to order and find a place to sit.

Overall:  when I have the craving I'll come...even if it's just for dessert!!!!!
author: Spencer Q.

description: I just started going here a few months ago...I have worked in the neighborhood for 4 years and been all around the Mission for many years on top of that and never knew this place existed! it's clean, reasonably priced, and their salsa bar is really really good. this has become my go to taqueria for lunch!!!!
author: Dina M.

description: A great spot for quick, fresh, made-to-order Mexican. Their carnitas tacos were huge and tasted amazing! They have a salsa bar with free chips for dine-in. I also had a delicious chicken quesadilla with plenty of fresh guacamole (optional) inside. I'll definitely be back!
author: Dallas D.

description:
Any say enough great things about this wonderful place. I've worked in the area for about 5 yrs now and have frequented this spot many times to get my shame-filled burritos. 

Excellent options, super clean, great salsa bar. I always get the tofu burrito which has to be one of the best in the city. I prefer it over anything else on the menu, it's prepared expertly.
author: Jourdain D.

description:
My favorite place in the mission.  They use fresh ingredients and it's good.  If your a vegetarian I highly recommend the cheese enchiladasU

UPDATE 3/2018:  Not my favorite...... I am not sure why, but they have switched to a lower quality cheese for their burritos and such.  Not nearly as good as it used to be.  Had to knock off a star.  TO OWNERS:  Why?  Maybe you are saving some money but allot of your customers will notice the poor quality and likely go elsewhere.USED
author: John C.

description: Super Burrito with everything all for $11.00. Can't beat that!!!!!!!!! VERY VERY VERY VERY FLAVORFUL!!!!!!!!!!!!! Fast, good eating, and friendly staff. Will definitely be coming back soon.
author: Arman M.

description: The guacamole was too salty. The horchata made from a mix. The two burritos: special chicken and special carne asada... it was like we got 2 bean and cheese burritos. I had higher hopes for this place, as it is located one block away from another amazing Mexican restaurant. It was an unsatisfying meal :/
author: Daven D.

description: After having second thoughts on my go to Mexican spot I came across this place. I just started working in the area and have literally been here at least twice a week. The place is super clean, the staff is very friendly and the food is on point. It's very traditional Mexican food, no added flares(something hard to find in the city with all the new up and coming hipster spots). It's also priced pretty decent for SF with a 10$ super burrito and dinner plates ranging from 8-10$. The best part about this spot, they have a salsa bar with all homemade salsas and they don't charge extra for chips (something that is getting harder and harder to find). Overall great spot and will be coming back. Just sad it's not in my neighborhood :(
author: Shannon H.

description:
Pretty solid taqueria in the area that seems to be a popular lunch spot for workers in the area. Don't be scared by the line that snakes out the door at noon! It moves fairly quickly. Most people seem to be ordering their food to-go, so if you need table space you can usually get some!

Most of their ala carte items are only a few bucks. The TACOS were large and I enjoyed my CHICKEN QUESADILLA (super). You can also get rice and beans on the side for a little extra. The portions are HUGE and pretty affordable. Grab a tamarind soda or Mexican coke to go with your meal. I love the SALSA BAR in the back for unlimited sauces to go with your meal.

I will be back when I crave some authentic Mexican food for lunch that doesn't break the bank.
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
The best bargain vegan burrito I've been able to find. You have to make sure not to get the yellow colored rice because it has chicken broth, but otherwise, just ask for your toppings (no cheese and sour creme) and load up on the delicious pico de gallo and other sauces. 

 I wish others could make a good, tasty vegan burrito and not overcharge! Thank you El  Tepa!
author: Michelle S.

description: Excellent customer service and Delicious food! Exceeded all expectations really nice atmosphere one of my favorite taquerias in San Francisco
author: Gaby G.

description:
I can't believe I only gave El Tepa 3 stars, 11 yrs ago.  What a jerk I was!
This is my go-to taqueria -- it's as good as any in the Mission IMO; it's not horribly busy (I usually go after work); the prices are great; and the ladies who work there are cool.  Good variety and quality (the fish and the al pastor are my favorites); and I love their salsa bar.  Good to eat in as well as to-go; and they recently installed a big HD TV so you can watch the Giants/Warriors/etc.
author: David P.

description: Solid but nondescript taqueria. Closed earlier than stated hours. Good in a pinch, but def not a classic.
author: Andrew K.

description: As everybody says, it's a solid authentic taqueria, just as great & value-centered as El Metate.  I ordered by grubhub and the carnitas burrito was long and thick, tightly wrapped, warm, and best of all NOT DRY AND ABSOLUTELY TASTY with soft carnitas and soft rice in a well-mixed saucy mixture, a well-prepared, whole meal!! The supernachos was 2 dinners in 1 they give you so much!!  Their watermelon agua fresca was fresh and tasty.  Their nachos was light, warm and overall tasty.  One thing I'd be afraid of ordering again is their roasted chile salsa--it has a sort of bitter heat I'm not used to--I'll stick to mild salsa next time!  Even with a delivery fee, it's worth it!!
author: Frugal C.

description: El Tepa is a great Taqueria! I've been going there for years and look forward to the excellent, fresh food and courteous service every time.
author: Valerie C.

description: My favorite Taqueria in the Mission, this are the best tacos of the area, pastor is awesome, carne asada are so good, cheap and very well served, good service, its the tastiest affordable place for your tacos in the Mission SF!!!
author: Jose Ramon L.

description:
One of the best taquerias in San Francisco.  Been coming here for a few years, finally getting around to writing a review.
Food is always good, that's why we keep coming back... ;) The place is nicely kept, staff are pretty friendly.  It's also nice that parking isn't as difficult in this part of town. 
The only small critique is that a few times their carne asada for the tacos seemed like it was ground beef. We decided to go with the chicken instead and it was by far a better yummy choice. 
I will definitely continue coming back and would recommend anyone to stop by and give it a try.
author: Zeesu C.

description: Wonderful establishment: Best grilled chicken burrito in the mission, excellent fish dinner plate, good chicken enchiladas and flautas. Great salsa variety. Simple and clean spot. Staff is always very nice and works really hard.
author: Nick R.

description:
I couldn't believe that I have been going to this place since being a Sophomore in high school but since it has been around since 1974 that's possible.  Honestly, it hasn't changed much, still serving very tasty Mexican food with consistency and cleanliness... I can only fault them and it hasn't been consistent for the temperature of the food.  Sometimes, it can taste cold.  But honestly this place deserves no less than 4 or 5 stars for food and 5 stars for cleanliness and price. 

The addition of the salsa bar is excellent, the green salsa verde deserves two thumbs up...  I will say I do miss that they don't sell beer any longer as there is nothing like the taste of a good Negra Modelo to chase that over stuffed super burrito.  I was impressed that the nephew of the original owner is working there, I remember him from that long ago.  Good to see the family is still in the business- I will be back and give my business to them as they have invested in this neighborhood for many years and it is still as good as it was over 30 years ago.
author: J P.

description: I moved to SF a year ago. I used to believe the Mission had the best burritos on earth. I've been mostly disappointed over the last year. I've had good burritos but today I had a great burrito. I had the Chile Relleno, special burrito. I don't like sour cream on my burritos, don't judge. In any case, I had an amazing burrito, football on the big screen, what else do I need?
author: David G.

description:
I started my yelp account so I could give this place 5 stars. 

I come here at least once a week to pickup burritos for my coworkers and myself.
The place is always nice and clean, the people are always super friendly, and the food is killer.

5 stars to El Tepa and their amazing salsa bar!
author: Ryan L.

description: Simple, fresh, fast, friendly, inexpensive, & yummy. Sounds like a perfect lunch to me. Family owned since 74'. The line is out the door now. They are doing something right.
author: Heather O.

description:
I had a chicken burrito. Very tasty. Meat was tender.

The place is clean and service is great
author: Roman K.

description: El Tepa is the burrito bomb!  The best burritos in the Mission, nay the city!  I know b/c my partner and I did a blind taste test (Cancun, El Farilito, and El Tepa).  The best ingredients, flavors, service, cleaninless, salsa bar.  Just love this place.  El Tepa is a weekly must!
author: Universal Citizen S.

description: There isn't anything new to be said about this place--the positive reviews hit the nail on the head. I have yet to be dissatisfied by El Tepa, from service to taste. In a neighborhood undergoing big change, it's nice to have this little corner of affordable consistency.
author: Leah L.

description: Sorry Tepa, I'm breaking up with you. Don't EVER use ground beef to make me a Carne Asada taco. That ain't coo!
author: Julia C.

description: Great place, very good burrito . People here nice and helpful. I'll be back , recommend to everyone.
author: Alex G.

description: Great discovery. Prices are reasonable, portions are great (split a burrito with a friend and I was very full), the sauces!!!! Are fresh, tasty, and clean. Joe is the man!! Thanks for welcoming us to the neighborhood.
author: Matthew S.

description: Consistently great food--especially the burritos. Service is usually fast and efficient.
author: Mark D.

description: Great taqueria if you are looking for fresh ingredients and friendly service.  My favorites are the chicken salad and the shrimp burrito (seafood is cooked when ordered, so allow extra time).  Staff are knowledgeable and you can customize your order easily.  Self-serve salsa bar is a plus.  Dining area and bathroom are always clean.
author: M G.

description: Never trust guacamole that is squirted out of a plastic container.  Plus they gasped when I requested no beans!
author: Kim E.

description: Only been once, too many better alternatives nearby. Ordered the chicken taquitos, they were stale and the sides were bland.
author: David G.

description:
Simply the cleanest, most well organized and best tasting Mexican spot in the Mission. I get 2 Super Tacos to go..... But on various occasions have requested a specific creation and they're nice enough to oblige! Think Steak and Shrimp burrito......

Their sauce counter is always wiped down, huge flat screen to stare at while you wait your turn, fresh grilled jalapeños with the sauces and they try their best to get you out as soon as possible.

Best Damn place in the Mission!
author: Connor M.

description: Quick, convenient, and tasty. I wish the TV weren't there, but otherwise the atmosphere is great. Not as loud in there as in many other Mission places (except for the TV).
author: Jon M.

description:
It's lunchtime. You considered all your options in the wondrous district that is the Mission, and El Tepa's delicious fish burrito, of which you had just a bite from a friend a couple days ago, calls to you. You buy it and bring it back to the office. 

Imagine biting into said burrito. The first bite is delicious. But there's no fish. You keep going--burritos aren't made evenly--but after consuming 1/3 of the burrito, your hope of fish waning with each bite, you realize: this is a vegetarian burrito. There is broccoli, red bell pepper, and zucchini, but no fish. Not that there is anything wrong with vegetarian burritos, but you thought you were getting fish, dammit. You are devastated and your hopes of getting protein dashed.

This is a true story.

You will still go back to El Tepa, because their food is good, prices are right, and tables clean and oft-wiped. Also because you work like a block away. But let all who hear this tale be warned: enunciate when you order. Do not be quiet, because they might not repeat your order back to you before springing into action and making you a vegetarian burrito that you most certainly did not ask for.
author: Jing B.

description:
I work in the area and have tried most burrito joints within a 4 block walk.

I usually look for the following things from a taqueria:

- good quality meat (minimal fat/gristle)
- fresh ingredients
- fairly priced
- good salsa bar
- nice staff
- be consistent

This place has hit them all for 5 years straight.  I've not once had a bad burrito or an attitude from the group at El Tepa.   I occasionally will venture somewhere a block or two closer for a burrito but always end up back at El Tepa.

I wouldn't say it's definitely my most favorite burrito in town as there are some really good burritos (Taqueria Cancun, Pancho Villa) but it's not far off, and the place feels a little more clean and comfortable.
author: Chris S.

description: First time eating at this taqueria. Got a chile relleno burrito and a chicken tamale. I liked the burrito, although it was pretty heavy on rice.  I thought the tamale tasted sour, but my husband enjoyed it.  I think the best thing going for El Tepa is their salsa bar.  The staff was really friendly.  I will definitely be back.
author: Michele J.

description: This place is overrated just because it's kind of cheap and because it's the only taqueria around! Their servers are totally uneducated. Their chicken mole always gives me diarrhea. This place has had issues with the health department--I was present when it happened. Their naturally flavored hand crafted refreshments are too sweet! Below average, overall!
author: Raymond F.

description:
Out of the three Taqueria spots ive been to in the immediate area.
Taboo, Flats and now El Tepa. This is exactly what i was looking for.
A very balanced and price proportionate meal for the right price and definitely college friendly even in a not so college based area.

Super Steak Quesadilla, oh wait a minute. Taboo doesnt have nor accomoate steak lovers when it comes to this treat... Tepa does!

2 medio liter mexican cokes and a steak Super-Q only for 14 dollars? i like...
Doesnt make me run to the bathroom like a perp running from the cops...i like..

What i don't like?.....well nothing really...i like this place so far...
Just wish their tortilla held together a little better when it comes to eating.
author: Eric C.

description: Great taqueria with a mouth-watering selection of salsas. Spicy chicken "Special Burrito" was top notch.
author: Jason S.

description: Grabbed a "super" fish taco so that I may use their restroom- which was very clean. Taco was reasonably priced, $3, and piled high- looked more like a salad. Was going to be impossible to eat as a taco, but luckily they give you a bag of chips to go so I ate it with that. It was yummy, tilapia was good too. Food looked hot and fresh, everyone there looked happy, whether cooking or eating.
author: Cori C.

description: A very mediocre super burrito. Don't go out of your way for this one, or, if this is close, make the trek out to some of the better tasting places.
author: Karl K.

description: Good burrito, great condiment bar (FRESH charred jalapenos!!), excellent service.  I'd come back again!  Oh...actual CHUNKS of avocado in my burrito...really fresh ingredients.
author: Tara S.

description:
Read a tip on Yelp saying to come before 12 due to the lunch crowd.  I went at 12:40ish and there was maybe 4 people...and the line moved quickly.  Made my order, paid, sat, ate....all good.  Carnitas was a bit dry.  But i don't like mexican food much anyway so I just stuffed my face with as much as I could bear...and got up.

While standing up to leave, I saw them cleaning behind the counter with rags.  Then the lady took the same rag used to clean the counter tops to clean the INSIDE of the agua fresca drinks.  OMFG!!!  I was so disgusted...holding my horchata in my hand...and I starred at her...and she continued to do it, in the horchata!!!  The agua fresca bottles are really clear and very clean looking...and now I know why!  Putting a wet dirty rag to clean the inside of the drink canister is NOT acceptable!!!!!!!!!!  

I'm just waiting for the diarrhea...  GAWD!

Another Yelper noted their high health score reports...DO NOT TRUST THEM.  I tend to say the dirty the yummier (with mex joints), but this is just wrong.
author: Janet L.

description:
One individual carne asada super taco was enough for me! And for comparison purposes - i can eat an average of 5 regular carne asada tacos at any other usual taqueria. I should have just skipped making it a "super" because all the added sour cream, lettuce, and tomato makes it to americanized. It reminds me of chevy's when i rather have a much more authentic meal. 

I've heard rave reviews about El Tepa so i'll be coming back to try their burritos and regular tacos!

I love that they have horchata!!
author: Samantha L.

description:
Pretty consistent taqueria, really clean and nice salsa bar. 

I've had the carnitas, chicken and fish. All nicely seasoned and a good amount of meat in their burritos.

I like that the have spinach tortillas and two types of pico de gallo (spicy and not as spicy). My favorite is their salsa verde.
author: Derrick V.

description: Pretty damn good. Small but tasty salsa bar too, including a fire roasted chiles option.
author: J S.

description: Loved the salsa bar at this super tasty, super clean and super friendly taqueria. Tacos were delish and the green salsa had chunks of avo! Charred jalapeños! Super huge menu. Will be back.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Just about the only place where I'll order a burrito.

It may be dangerous to admit in SF, but I don't generally like burritos.  I think that it's the proportions; too much starch to meet for my taste.  I'm more of a taco guy and never really understood the allegiance to burritos in this area.  Everyone seems to eat burritos around here; I think that I even saw a Mexican guy eating one once!

That said, I enjoy burritos at El Tepa.  I started coming here when I worked in the area a decade ago.  I'm not a regular by any means, but I do still stop in now and then.  They used to hand out a lot of discount coupons; and that helped to drive my traffic.  

My burrito of choice here is the spicy shrimp; do they call it camarones diablos here?  One thing that I like is that the ratio of shrimp to starch in the burrito is pretty high.  Also, the burrito is not an overstuffed monster that's difficult to handle (those sometimes break apart when eating).  

So, just a simple place, but they do this dish well.
author: Jice E.

description: Super clean, fresh ingredients, quality food, excellent service! Eat there!
author: Feliz L.

description: Okay, this place is the tits. I usually don't use those words, but this place had everything going for it. No line for food. Clean restrooms. Friendly service. Reasonable prices. And amazing food. I got the relleno which came with chips, beans, refried beans, three tortillas, tomatoes and lettuce. Left there full and happy. Tried everything on the salsa bar too. Bam! Go there.
author: Tim L.

description: Just forget this place, it's way too mediocre.  High volume, low quality food.  Rice - cold .  Canned beans - luke warm.  Meats cooked in advance and set out for hours - and barely warm.  Burrito - barely warm due to above ingredients.   No flavor.  Bare minimum bare bones go into the food quality and prep.  And, everything costs around $10 - which is way to much to pay for the highly mediocre quality.  Just
author: Sammy S.

description: To the moron that thinks all they do is clean the jug with a rag they don't they take them in the back and wash them I know because I asked instead of assuming besides that great food delicious burritos and if u don't like Mexican food don't eat it, it's like being allergic to something and eating it anyways STUPID
author: B I.

description:
I've been a Mission local for six years, but I still won't claim I'm the expert in the much-discussed Quest for the Ultimate Burrito. It's such a matter of taste, frankly. 

What I will say is that El Tepa has the absolute most amazing carnitas burrito, and it's my personal favorite. If you haven't added it to your ultimate burrito search, you must. 

The staff is so darling, and over time, remember my order, making me feel both beloved and somewhat like a little piggy.

No matter.
author: Jill C.

description:
Good, delicious traditional Mexican food! I love this place because it is very close to my work so I frequently indulge in their Super Veggie Burrito. The chips are good and not heavily salted, and their "hot" salsa is actually spicy. The employees are always very nice and they are very quick with getting my meal to me in less than 5 minutes (unless you order something with chicken - it tends to take a little longer). Their is a lot of flavor in everything they serve. The flautas are good and crispy and I really love the corn quesadillas.

This place gets very busy between 12:00 and 1:00pm so expect a line of people. Again though, they are quick. The one downfall is that they are not open on weekends and since I work weekends, it would be nice to have the option. I'm hoping someday soon they will open their doors to the public on Saturday and Sunday, and when they do, 5 stars it will be! :)
author: Amber Y.

description: Pretty good burrito. It's flavorful and moist but I still like the one near my house. I'm probably biased because it's the one I grew up with. On the upside, it's very clean and not much of a crowd during weekdays.
author: Shirlene K.

description:
First, the good: the chicken taco I had was delicious and worthy of 3.5 stars.

Then the bad: the fish taco was horrible, lacked any type of seasoning and had a slightly fishy taste and worthy of 1.5 stars.

The counter person did not use a slotted spoon to add my black beans to the plate and my tortillas were ridiculously soggy. Soggy anything is unappetizing. Apparently other yelpers have had similar experiences.. It's not rocket science... when I order black beans I want the beans NOT the juice they're swimming in. Maybe we should clue them into the recent invention of the slotted spoon?

Service was ok, the woman who took my order could not have been less enthusiastic. But the cashier was nice so I guess they balance each other out to an average of adequate service.
author: Dani D.

description: Low quality food. Their meat is disgusting, low quality and hard. It's almost uneatable from how hard it is. Their refried beans also had a distinct after taste. Never buying from here again.
author: Karla M.

description:
The competition in the Mission is pretty stiff, but this joint rocks with the best of them.  

The carnitas tacos are a classic, and you will day dreaming about them for days afterwards.

Bigger portions than usual for the cash (and the prices are cheap).  A good line crew that gets your food to you fast. 

Best overlooked item on the menu: cebollitas (grilled/marinated green onions).
author: Hunter C.

description: Went to El Tepa today by chance and had the best veggie taco ever! Don't know what the meat is like but I can say that this place has amazingly fresh ingredients. If you know your tomatoes like I do (I grow them) this was an 11/10. I am truly impressed and will go back for more.
author: Anca R.

description:
I haven't tasted a better garden burrito in the Mission.  The other options are yummy, too, except the tofu one's a little too cold and spongy because it soaks too long.  Nice tacos.  Pretty cheap, but I don't like paying extra for cheese I don't want just to get guacamole and sour cream, the obvious combo.  But the staff is great.  El Tepa's my favorite.

Sometimes there are ants on the tables.
author: Jae R.

description:
Solid mexican on the edge of the Mission.    Food has been good on every visit and I love that it's always very clean.

Two tacos are a big meal!
author: Dave C.

description:
i had the most expensive burrito of all time today. $61 (including a parking ticket for street cleaning on the rainiest day of the year)
was it worth the parking infraction fee. not exactly.
the salsa bar had an orange sauce reminiscent of orange sauce from san jose's La Victoria Taqeria chain. this is a major plus.
 i ordered the carnitas special burrito  which is marinated roast pork. a little on the dry side and not really super flavorful. the smell of the day though was the carne asada being cooked to order. so this dish will be my next order here. but i cannot afford to park and eat here very often.
author: Jeff W.

description: El Tepa has the distinction of being voted 'Best Taqueria' by the viewers of KPIX 5 in 1972.
author: Erich V.

description: I've been picking up dinner here once a week for over a year, and I only ever get a veggie tostada salad and an agua fresca.  It's always pretty tasty and the staff is super nice.  When I pick up around 6:30 someone is always cleaning something, so this place is very clean, maybe a bit too clean...to the point where occasionally my food has a weird after taste of formula 409 or something.... and that's my only complaint.
author: Lalitha B.

description:
I'm currently munching on a super chile relleno burrito from El Tepa.
I had received a coupon for $2 off (yippee) and felt the need to try out another local taco shop. I don't have favorites here in the Mission, despite getting Mexican all the time. I'm a vegetarian so my choices anywhere I go are limited.

Tepa was clean and friendly. It's a typical mexican fast food joint in the Mission. To be honest, 1/2 a star goes to my surprise at how clean and nice it was. The red exterior in a more remote section always scared me away from trying this place. 

Still, I'd go back. I mean, they have a Tofu and a Garden burrito (veggies can start swooning) which I have to try. And they gave me a boat load of chips which a)aren't stale and b) taste pretty good.

There's nothing terribly remarkable about Tepa except more veggie friendly options and its actually not bad. 4 stars for all that and that bag of chips.
author: Anjel O.

description: I work right by this place and theres a few places i can eat otherwise but this oplace takes the cake.. Right one i walked in it was so clean and customer service a plus!! the salsa bar clean, fresh and tasty.  the chicken is being grilled in the morning which equals fresh people .. yes fresh food!!!
author: Des D.

description:
2 tacos:
Carnitas are very good
Al pastor is not
author: Christopher L.

description:
Best veggie and tofu burritos in sf! I've been to the almost all the burrito shops and 15 year in a row winner cancun taqueria 50 times and this place smokes them,very clean,nice staff local neighborhood vibe,the salsa bar is very fresh and plentiful,I try to go there a few times a month and I work in the mission and choose them,they have like 98 points outta 100 on the Heath department score! The dude that works there is always super nice to me and so is the mamacita that makes my grub!
Rolling fatty burritos  since 1977 for a reason,,,,
author: James B.

description:
So, I said I'd go back and I did. Thanks to my overly needy buddies at Val-U-Sort. OK guys, OK, I understand you want to save me money but why not just have a handy website I can access at my leisure? If you remind me one more time about how organized my closet could be I'm going to smack you in the mouth. 

Oh, but we're talking about El Tepa. Thanks to the handy dandy $2 off Dinner Plate coupon Val-U-Annoy gave me I went back for a second run on the carnitas. Here's a little tidbit about Mission taquerias in general: if you were going to get two super tacos anyway you're better off getting the plate. It basically works out to 3 super tacos for the price of 2.5. That's half a super taco for free! And if you're sporting a $2 off coupon? Well, prepare for leftovers! 

I'm bumping El Tepa up from 2 (really 2.5) to 3 stars because the carnitas came correct this time around and the salsa bar was up and running. I'd happily not be able to give them 3.5 stars but they seem to be zeroed in on the sad-sack-iest employees of all taqueria history. That's saying something because, if there's one thing all us Mission folk know it's that a cheerful taqueria employee is as likely as meeting somebody interesting at the creepy laundry mat that's closest to your house but also soul damaging. Sure, it COULD happen but it's all together so unlikely you don't even bother getting your hopes up. Well, El Tepa just set a new Creepy Mission Laundry Mat to Taqueria analogy low. I tried all my tricks; my bad gringo Spanish, my happy carnitas yum yum dance, the suspiciously cheerful goodbye. No dice. 

So, head to El Tepa if you've got a coupon and a hankerin' for thoroughly mediocre fare with a free side order of maudlin. On second thought, go get a corn dog at Whiz-Burger. At least you'll have the illicit thrill of potentially being jumped by the crazy resident crackhead with the Bozo the Clown haircut.
author: Milk N.

description: I love their fresh food.  They're super fast, nice people and really good food.  Super clean restaurant too.  The salsas are very tasty too.
author: Dana M.

description:
Sometimes the days go fast and you really don't have time to break and sit and eat but keep on working. Like when we did some creative stuff for the band, Blame It On Sally.

It was convenient, fast but not fast food and filling and cheap.
author: Brandon M.

description:
Wow I had no idea this place even existed! When I saw El Tepa, I had $5 and an empty soul (your stomach is your soul!), but left stuffed after one super taco.

What I like about this place is all the fresh lettuce and tomato they put all over my food. This definitely averted the nasty feeling one usually gets after eating at a Taqueria. I would even go as far as to say I was refreshed, which really never happens. 

My chicken mole was also deliciously flavored and tender. I'll definitely be back!
author: Ryan V.

description:
Yum.

This is one of my favorite taquerias, and I've eaten at all of them in the Mission.  

Yes, the food is a BIT more expensive than other taquerias in the neighborhood, but it's worth it.  Their chicken mol is the best!!  The salsas are dynamite also--try the salsa roja.

I don't know how difficult parking really is, since I work a block away and always just walk, but the location is cool--it's not in the middle of all the madness and is usually occupied with regulars.

If you go at lunch time, try to go before 12pm....otherwise you'll find a line out the door!!  But even at their busiest times the line moves fast.

I actually feel like walking down there right now.....
author: Yelper F.

description:
I ordered a chicken flauta & carne asada taco all for $4.25!  But:

The flauta was too salty.

An order of taco only comes with 1.  The carne asada was too bland.  It tastes like they just sauteed it in oil & thats it.  Most of the meat was cartiledge.  The taco is loaded with meat, so you should order the chicken.  

I think the best part of this place was the salsa bar!
author: Jo B.

description:
I frequent this place because it is near where I work. Otherwise not the greatest location, but if you are nearby it's a great option!
I like it because it's clean, always good food, good service and they take ATM on a $5 charge.
I usually get the vegetarian tostada (I haven't seen this most places), burrito or taco.
author: Jenna E.

description:
I randomly walked into El Tepa Taqueria because it is a block from my new office.  In my short time in SF I am determined to find the best burrito place, so I got there super veggie burrito... perhaps not my favorite in all of SF (the one in Bernal Heights kick arse), but simply yummy indeed.  

I use Yelp a lot to make my lunch decisions for me and I noticed that El Tepa never came up in the searches.  I decided they needed a review to mark them on the map as a cheap friendly place to get a burrito, taco, etc. for lunch/ dinner.  Their ingredients are much more fresh than other places I have been in the mission and they are now open on Saturdays, which is being promoted with a 2 dollar coupon (YAY even cheaper food on the weekends).

As someone new to the neighborhood, I am happy to say I have found a delicious and convenient little lunch spot.
author: Becky T.

description:
Most taquerias in The Mission are simply great--but each taqueria seems to have one or two signature items that are particularly well done when compared to comparable dishes from their peers and neighbors.  In the case of El Tepa, order these for a four-star experience:

(1) Any dish making use of the meat known as "al pastor," or marinated pork.  It's spicy and flavorful, and isn't a fatty mess like al pastor from other taquerias.

(2) Some days, especially on those of the rainy variety, El Tepa offers "pozole," a garbanzo bean and pork soup that comes with a bunch of add-as-you-desire sides like onions, cilantro, and copious amounts of lime.  There's a unique satisfaction in taking pozole back to work and having a little slurpfest in my office on a rainy day.
author: Richard E.

description:
Moved to a new office in this area a few days a week and wanted to check out this place based on the reviews of my fellow yelpers as well as the fact that it is so close to me.  
Unlike many on here, I was unimpressed.  Ordering here and seeing the food in front of me made me have flashbacks to the junior high cafeteria, the food in the bins just did not look appetizing.  The tortilla i had was tough and maybe a bit stale.  I had a super burrito with Carnitas which turned out to be a rice and bean burrito so much so that I could barely taste the Carnitas.  Also, other taqueria's I've been to have the uncanny ability to spread the myriad of ingredientes (yes, I speak fluent spanish!) so that you get it all in every bite, not so here.
I'll give them another chance, but not before I explore the hood a bit.

One star for fast service, one star for proximity, one star for decent hot salsa and ample seating.
author: Kanoa B.

description:
I've been grabbing lunch, or dinner-to-go here for years, and the food is consistently good.  I truly can't remember any time I've had to wait behind more than one customer.  Service is fast and efficient.  Plus the place is so clean you could eat off the counter.  As a  matter of fact I was there the other night and while I waited for by burrito, one of the other ladies was detailing around the edges of the hot bins with Q-TIPS!  It seems like every minute they are not serving a customer, they are engaged in some kind of cleaning activity.
But back to the food....Excellent vegetarian burritos and tacos, yummy homemade tamales and enchiladas if you're up for something different.  Plenty of vegetarian options and they are happy to customize it however you want.
author: SFnativeGal ..

description: I LOVE this place! Not only are the staff incredibly nice and jovial, but as a Mexican and former vegetarian, I really appreciate the variety on their menu- variety that stays true to the FRESH, authentic Mexican flavor I expect. Highly recommend! PS: the "hot" stuff (mix of raw jalapeño, tomato, onion & cilantro) is actually hot, so fresh that the jalapeño crunches, and adds lots of flavor to anything!
author: Kiki B.

description:
I work near this place, so I go there pretty frequently.  (No, I don't sell crack, but that's a decent guess based on the neighborhood).  
Service is friendly, usually pretty fast, and the food is good.  Why then just a 3 out of 5?  
Quality of meat is slightly suspect.  Chicken is occasionally undercooked and I've also discovered what I believe to be tire rubber in the beef.  
But man, when there's no tire rubber, it is deliche!
author: Dan H.

description: We were in a hurry, so my husband ordered two chicken super burritos and one carne asada super burrito for takeout. Besides the fact that all were mislabeled there was very little meat in all three burritos...mostly beans and rice. Overall taste was bland...complimentary chips were ok.
author: A O.

description:
I'm knocking them down from three stars to two because every time I've gone in there in the past month, they've been rude and short. Not that I have anything against short people- after all, they got no reason for livin' - but they used to be nice and short. 
Same meh veggie burrito, same meh decor.

Update 2/26/07: Back up to four stars for the spicy prawn burrito. If I don't barf in the next 24 hours, I think I can safely say I've found food nirvana.
author: Alyssa R.

description:
I used to work by this place and there are still days I crave a super grilled chicken quesadilla from here..served with a huge side of chips! Yum!

The staff is usually friendly too! Great phone ahead- to go place!
author: Valerie A.

description:
When it comes to burritos, I'm all about the flavor, sabor authentico! (as we say in my native San Francisco).
El Tepa is above average.
It's also clean and the staff is friendly as well. Their tofu is better than most, and the beans are vegan and still good. 
You aren't going to find parking on Valencia or 16th, so if you want to grab a couple of burritos for dinner on your way home this is a good alternative.
author: Jason D.

description:
I eat here every week, so that means over 60 times so far.  

Is there such a thing as a 5 star taqueria?  Unlikely.  4 stars? That would require a) a salsa bar that makes me want to rip my clothes off, b) year round christmas lights. c) tamales from heaven.  The freshly grilled tacos at El .Grullense in Redwood City and the South Bay are 4-5 star material.

El Tepa uses all freshly prepared ingredients, and grills chicken and shrimp right in front of you at the counter.  They are very friendly, the service is fast during long lunch time lines, the food is cheap, and the place is very friendly, and it is spic-and-spam clean always.  

El Tepa occupies a sunny corner in an out-of-way spot a few blocks off Mission, so the traffic here is decidely local and loyal. I probably would not hunt this place down because there are options on Mission and Valenica that are equal or better, but very few better.
author: Jeff W.

description:
Good spicey chicken burritos. Haven't tried anything else here. The ingredients seem pretty fresh -- which is massively important to me -- and flavorful. It's cleaner than your average taqueria, which basically means the environment is sterile and not particularly charming. Still, I go to taquerias to cure an empty stomach, not for atmosphere or people watching. 

You can get the usual choices of beans and tortillas here. Unfortunately, they cater mostly to a clientele of day workers so they close pretty early at night.
author: Alan R.

description:
Totally serviceable taqueria across the street from my office. Nothing stands out, everything is edible, decent prices, quick service, they take credit cards.

Seriously, any taqueria worse than this place shouldn't be able to stay in business. Not that this place is bad - it's totally fine - but there's no excuse for anywhere that isn't even capable of being as mediocre as El Tep. 

I eat here multiple times per week.
author: Josh K.

description:
* One star for being within 30 seconds from my office
* One star for friendly, clean, quick
* One star for decent burritos

Definitely NOT yummy fish tacos, and the veggie burritos are, as I said, decent. The ones with actual vegetables, as opposed to just rice and beans, has what tastes like thawed frozen broccoli, cauli, carrot blend. Hmm.
author: Cary M.

description: I eat here on a regular basis as it is the closest Taqueria to my office. The food is always consistent, the place always clean and the staff fast and friendly. I would recommend a fish tostada salad.
author: Paul J.

description: Best kept secret Taqueria in the city....so shut the F*** up and don't tell nobody!
author: Arlene C.

description: Really great burritos and a few other things like prawn quesadillas. They get it right: fresh ingredients, great prep, super clean, reasonable prices, and friendly crew. I'd describe this place as quality authentic mexican -- not a fancy place, and not a dive. Just frickin' tasty and fresh.
author: David M.

description:
best vegetarian burrito in sf. super fresh beans, cheese and guac. rice like my momma used to make. okay, still makes.
don't talk to me about el farolito or cancun, they don't even measure up.

i cannot speak for other items on the menu as i've never been able to get past the veggie burrito.
author: Lisa Marie G.

description:
What a great find.  I had no reason to go there except it was lunch time and this place was close.  Now, I crave it.  The place looks pretty basic and almost too simple.  It is always clean, the staff is always so friendly and quick.  The chicken is super yummy.  I can spend about $10 on food and a drink and have enough leftovers for another meal.  If you are in the area and looking for delish mexican food, I would absolutely give it a try.

Dang, I am craving it again just writing about them!
author: Mel L.

description: I think that this place is the best around... great veggie items, and great fresh salsa!
author: Laura P.

description: Great burrito in a random spot. The tofu pieces were gigantic, the spinach tortilla seemed more delicious the usual, and two choices of rice. Really good.
author: Jason B.

description: OMG --- I think I am on a roll with reviews of my favorite taquerias in the City! El Tepa is a secret in the heart of 17th and Folsom Streets! This place is never, ever crowded and they serve the BEST, I mean the BEST prawn burrito in all of San Francisco (well, all that I have tasted so far!). The prawns are marinated in their secret sauce and it just gives an orgasmic taste to the burrito when you bite into it. If you ask for "super," they really pile it on with all the good stuff (guac, sour cream, etc.) and you will be eating this burrito for days! I've also tried their super nachos with grilled chicken and it was great as well. The ladies are always very nice and efficient and they never get an order wrong......Whenever you are in the area, you gotta try this place and if you craving some good Mexican food, this is the place to go!
author: La C.

description: It's consistently satisfying, this lonely little taqueria in the middle of nowhere at the obscure corner of 18th and Folsom.  And thank god for the consistency as it's one of two choices to which one can get run and get lunch in time to actually eat it after going out to get it since I toil in the world of the 30 minute lunch break.  The lovely lovely ladies at El Tepa are always pleasant and almost remember exactly what I'm gonna order when I walk in the door.
author: Kevin M.

description: This place is great. I go almost every day for my lunch breaks.  Everyone is really friendly, the food it great, especially the green salsa, and its  pretty cheap.  They also have a huge variety of beverages and colorful little tables.  Brightens my day every time.   I also swear that somehow they have the most amazing avocados that I have ever tasted in my life. It must be because they cut them with love.
author: Naomi M.

description: I was kind of in the neighborhood....ha I work in the pac heights and wanted a burrito.  So I drove here with my co-worker and she usually gets me stuff from here.  I ordered a super chicken burrito.  I figured if I am gonna eat I might as well get it with all the fixings.  My super burrito came with chicken, cheese, salsa. guacamole, hot salsa, rice, sour cream and a little bit if black beans....I usually skip the beans but I was trying not to discriminate.  The burrito was good with their green tomatillo sauce.  Definitely a huge difference from what I can get in the Pac Heights.s
author: Allison T.

description: This is simply the best Taqueria in SF!  Why?? First the food is great - I usually get the roasted chicken or carnitas burritos, but I hear the fish is excellent.  The prices are modest, the service excellent (they are always so cheerful), its probably the cleanest taqueria in the Mission, and finding parking near by is always easy.   Their only downside is that they are not open on seven days a week.
author: Tony F.

description:
Super Clean, fresh ingredients, huge menu, friendly staff.

Sauces look like they're made fresh daily, and I should know I eat  here every other day. Super Tacos really are "Super" ....they're huge. I can usually eat 4-5 tacos, here only 2 fit.

My favorite part about this place is the Jalapeno's that are pickled fresh and stored in the sauce counter. They're crisp and spicy. Not like those other places that are boiled mushy and pickled to death. Also, the rice is the bomb! Most mexican rice I eat is dry, here it's moist and tastes so good I could eat it by itself.

Lastly my only comlaint rests with  the Flauta's. Those things are so good I gained like 10 pounds trying to sneak them into my usual burrito order.
author: connor m.

description: I think this place is the best.. I have been here about 5-6 times, and every time I go here I always have the best service, and everyone who have helped me is really nice. I met the owner Joe, and he is also very nice to me when ever I come here. Also they have a perfect clean score, and their food is Awesome. When ever someone asks for food suggestions I always tell them to go here...
author: Bridget A.

description: A Neapolitan sherbet-like color scheme heavy on pastels blends with bright highlights and similarly colored tables to create a comfy dining area with a soothing aura.  I had a chicken burrito that was both adequately seasoned and large enough to satisfy.  Thumbs up for the serve-yourself condiment/salsa table too!  Parking in the hood isn't too bad, and seating is never a hassle.  Although I'm a devoted carnivore, I've had my veggie friends give this place a thumbs-up.  Not the best...but better than most.
author: Mike W.

description: This is the cleanest taqueria in the MIssion and the food just rocks. A work colleague took me here for lunch one day and I am hooked. I have the grilled fish taco with black beans and some times I have them throw on some cheese and guac. Outstanding. I have also had a carne asada burrito which was fresh and tasty. If you are in the area, stop by.
author: Deborah S.

description: Ok I have to give El Tepa 5 stars now that they have the salsa bar.  The aguas frescas are always delicious and so many too choose from.
author: SOPHIA C.

description: Not the best in the mission but if you want a gigantic taco piled high with meat, this is it. I've had the burritos, don't care for it but the tacos... Mmm. Since I work in the area,  it's my quick fix for $2.50
author: Richard K.

description:
bland blah blah bland blah.
nothing special.  just a taqueria with ok food.


Who microwaves nachos anyway?  eeeew?!?  not sure where they learned that...but it needs to stop.  Talk about gross!
author: Matt V.

description: As far as taquerias goes, this place is 4 stars!  Great food, fresh ingredients, fast service.  Had their al pastor (bbq pork) burrito here today.  The al pastor was very flavorful and the regular burrito was a decent size not like some places where they don't give you alot of meat and and the tortilla is wrapped around twice!  Will have to come back and try some of their other dishes.  My only gripe is they don't put the salsa, pickled carrots/jalapeno, and limes out so you can get it yourself like some places.
author: Rick P.

description: Absolutely my favorite veggie burrito.  Kept simple.  Beans, veg rice, salsa verde and avocado.  Sooo good.  Honestly I've never tried anything else here.  Why mess with perfection?
author: Carmen R.

description: I was a huge fan of Pancho Villa and El Farolito, but the lines got too long for me.  Because this place isn't in the center of all the craziness, it doesn't get too busy, the service is fast(ish) and friendly, and the food is great.
author: Dudley F.

description: They have the best super carnitas burrito, and the prawn dishes are also done to perfection.  The servers are always friendly, the portions are large, and it's perfect for lunch.
author: Sandra C.

description: Good lunch spot. It is very clean and the service is always great. The same ladies have been here for year. Although taco truck burritos are better, El Tepa has great quesadillas and seafood options.
author: Ginny M.

description:
the ladies who work behind the counter here, are soo nice! 
they have the best tofu burrito, it's addicting (i work nearby, and was having to get one a week) -the tofu is marinated to perfection, they have vegan rice (in addition to their regular mexican rice) and vegan refried beans, add a little avocado (guacamole not so vegan) and I have food coma for the rest of the day at work.  They're clean, and I've never gotten sick there.. I recommend them to customers at work all the time
author: Megan C.

description: I love this place!  I get the shrimp quesadilla and it is delicious!  Today I got a carne asada tostada salad and it is awesome.  I have been eating here for the over 3 years I have worked nearby and it is excellent!
author: Chri S.

description: i ordered a pretty expensive super burrito (over $7) with beef. it was a very tasty burrito but the beef contained rubbery/chewy parts which wasnt necessary the beef but may have been fat or bone. that's a first for me at a taqueria. i could find a better burrito for cheaper else where.
author: Helen L.

description: i went there once a couple weeks ago. and i got a super vegitarian burrito. it was horrible. it was like wet and soggy. right after they made it. i couldnt even eat it. and besides one of the ladies was cleaning the windows that were right next to the food, which didnt get me too excited about thinking there was prolly some prayed soap in my food. i will never go here again.
author: Nicole F.

description: suprisingly very good taqueria in the outlands just a short stroll from 18th and mission. not everyone's gonna make it there, but if u do its not disappointing. my son lives a few blocks away, so it was conveniently closer than mission or valencia.  I had the spinach tortilla w refriend beans, rice and guacamole and a little hot sauce. it was really enjoyable, prices are affordable.  3 family members also very much enjoyed their burritos.    stephen
author: stephen s.
